modules.description: Provides functions to construct and manage IPv4 configuration streams, including parsing and validating network settings. Operates on streams of IP configuration data, enabling asynchronous handling of network parameters. Used to initialize and configure network interfaces in MirageOS-based applications.

Sleeps for a specified number of nanoseconds using a non-blocking, asynchronous approach. Operates on 64-bit integers to represent time durations. Useful for precise timing control in concurrent applications, such as rate limiting or synchronizing events.

Handles parsing and serialization of DHCP protocol messages, including options and message types. Operates on byte sequences and custom record types representing DHCP packets. Used to process incoming DHCP requests and generate appropriate responses in networked applications.

Handles IPv4 configuration streams by parsing, validating, and managing network settings asynchronously. Processes data through streams to initialize and configure network interfaces. Key data types include configuration records and stream parsers, with operations for validation, construction, and parameter extraction. Examples include setting static IP addresses, parsing DHCP options, and managing interface initialization in MirageOS environments.

Provides precise, non-blocking sleep functionality using 64-bit integers for time durations, enabling accurate timing in concurrent systems. Supports asynchronous delays that do not block the main execution thread, ideal for managing event synchronization or rate limiting. Examples include pausing network requests between retries or coordinating timed state transitions. Operates independently of higher-level abstractions, focusing on low-level timing control.
